items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels are high on the Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck due to heavy rainfall.
River levels are forecast to begin falling this evening as rainfall eases.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Broadwey river level gauge as a result of the ground being saturated and reacting to heavy rainfall overnight. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Wey, Preston Brook and River Jordan. Consequently flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 04:30 tomorrow morning (15/11/22). Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. The heavy rain is due from approximately 23:00 this evening (14/11/22) until 11:00 (15/11/22) followed by showers for the rest of the day, some heavy. We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Tuesday 15th November or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are rising on the River Wey as a result of heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is expected later this morning, 15/11/22, around the Passfield Mill area. Further rainfall is forecast this evening and over the next few days. We expect river levels to remain high as a result. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening, 15/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: Water levels have risen at the Chetnole river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall. Consequently, there is a low risk of flooding to low-lying land and roads today, Tuesday, 15/11/22. Locations most vulnerable to flooding are the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Further showers are forecast throughout today, 15/11/22, and tomorrow, 16/11/22. We expect river levels to remain high over the next 24 hours. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. Please refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Tuesday, 15/11/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message: River levels are forecast to rise at the Charmouth river level gauge as a result of the ground being saturated and reacting to heavy rainfall overnight. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 3:00 tomorrow morning (15/11/22). Flooding is possible on the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. The heavy rain is due from approximately 23:00 this evening (14/11/22) until 11:00 (15/11/22) followed by showers for the rest of the day, some heavy. River levels can rise very quickly in response to rainfall. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Tuesday 15th November or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Flooding is possible this morning, Tuesday 15th November. Overnight we have seen heavy rainfall over Dartmoor, and river levels are now rising. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible this morning. We expect river levels to remain high throughout Tuesday, and may issue Flood Warnings as necessary. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated on Tuesday afternoon (15/11/22) or earlier as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight tonight and into Tuesday 15th November 2022.
Heavy rainfall is forecast in the East Devon area overnight from midnight through Tuesday morning.  This will cause water levels to rise in the River Axe area. 
The main areas of concern will be low lying land and roads close to the river. 
We expect the river to remain high throughout Tuesday and may issue Flood Warnings as necessary.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
We are constantly monitoring river levels and will have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Tuesday afternoon or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Chiselborough river gauge due to overnight heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 15/11/22.  Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Further heavy showers are expected over the next 24 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation and our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Tuesday, 15/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Plym, Tory Brook, Long Brook

items.message: Flooding is possible from 4:30am on Tuesday 15th November. Heavy rain overnight has caused the River Plym to respond and rapidly rise. While heavy overnight rain has passed, further rain is forecast throughout Tuesday. Expected levels result in flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. We expect the river to remain high throughout Tuesday, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.  Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.  We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on Tuesday evening or earlier if the situation changes. Weather conditions will remain unsettled throughout the week.

River levels are rising on the Upper Dorset Frome at Maiden Newton and Hooke due to heavy rainfall overnight and this morning (15/11/22). Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Frome and tributaries with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Toller Whelme and Dorchester. Further rain is forecast until late morning followed by showers this afternoon, some heavy. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 17:00 on 15/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising steadily on the Upper Dorset Frome and Hooke River due to heavy rainfall overnight and this morning (15/11/22). Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Frome and Hooke River, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around Dorchester Road and Frome Lane area of Maiden Newton. There is a forecast for showers this afternoon and evening and so with already rising river levels there is a risk of flooding to properties. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this warning if necessary. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. Plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 18:00 on 15/11/22, or as the situation changes.
